headline: Tuesday briefing: The Supreme Courts leaked abortion opinion; primaries in Ohio and Indiana; stormy forecasts; Met Gala; and more
sentences: The bigger picture: Republican-led states have passed a wave of antiabortion legislation ahead of the decision, and antiabortion groups are making plans for a nationwide ban.
What happened: A leaked draft of an opinion published last night said the court was prepared to strike down Roe v. Wade, which established abortion rights in 1973.
What were watching: The Republican race in Ohio to decide who will be on the ballot in November to replace retiring Sen.
Polls close at 7:30 p.m. Eastern time; Indiana polls close at 6 and 7 p.m. Well have results and updates here.
But, if it happens, overturning Roe would leave the legality of abortion up to individual states.
This draft may not be final and an actual ruling could be months away.
Vance, endorsed by former president Donald Trump, has a slight edge.
What else to know: Ohio also has a governors race on the ballot.
Its a crowded field, but Hillbilly Elegy? author J.D.
Whoever wins is likely to face Democrat Tim Ryan.
